channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump’s reelection casts a shadow over the start of global climate negotiations
item.description: Trump’s return to the White House raises questions about whether the country will continue working on global climate initiatives.
item.content:encoded:
Trump’s return to the White House raises questions about whether the country will continue working on global climate initiatives.



(Image credit: Sergei Grits/AP)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: Alzheimer’s timeline shows changes start as trickle, become torrent
item.description: A study of cells from 84 brains finds that Alzheimer’s has two distinct phases, and that one type of neuron is especially vulnerable.
item.content:encoded:
A study of cells from 84 brains finds that Alzheimer’s has two distinct phases, and that one type of neuron is especially vulnerable.

(Image credit: koto_feja/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: Wisconsin high court to hear arguments on whether an 1849 abortion ban remains valid
item.description: The Wisconsin Supreme Court will hear oral arguments Monday on whether a law that legislators adopted more than a decade before the Civil War bans abortion and can still be enforced.
item.content:encoded:
The Wisconsin Supreme Court will hear oral arguments Monday on whether a law that legislators adopted more than a decade before the Civil War bans abortion and can still be enforced.

(Image credit: Harm Venhuizen)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: It’s Veterans Day. The VA says it can’t help thousands of vets it left stranded
item.description: An NPR investigation finds thousands of veterans were pushed into high-cost mortgages by a program that was meant to help them. A rescue plan being rolled out by the Department of Veterans Affairs is excluding many vets who need help.
item.content:encoded:
An NPR investigation finds thousands of veterans were pushed into high-cost mortgages by a program that was meant to help them. A rescue plan being rolled out by the Department of Veterans Affairs is excluding many vets who need help.

(Image credit: Michael Noble Jr.)
item.dc:creator: Chris Arnold

item.title: When her key broke in the ignition, a car thief saved the day
item.description: After her car key broke, Betsy Cornwell was stranded and all alone. Then the unlikeliest of heroes came to her aid.
item.content:encoded:
After her car key broke, Betsy Cornwell was stranded and all alone. Then the unlikeliest of heroes came to her aid.

(Image credit: Betsy Cornwell)
item.dc:creator: Autumn Barnes

item.title: More young people are surviving cancer. Then they face a life altered by it
item.description: More people are getting cancer in their 20s, 30s, and 40s, and surviving, thanks to rapid advancement in care. Many will have decades of life ahead of them, which means they face greater and more complex challenges in survivorship. Lourdes Monje is navigating these waters at age 29.
item.content:encoded:
More people are getting cancer in their 20s, 30s, and 40s, and surviving, thanks to rapid advancement in care. Many will have decades of life ahead of them, which means they face greater and more complex challenges in survivorship. Lourdes Monje is navigating these waters at age 29.

(Image credit: Caroline Gutman for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: Biden was given a film camera. The result? A new, intimate view of the White House
item.description: The creators behind the viral TikTok account @lifeonfilm.27 give film cameras to strangers all over the world. In September, they handed one to one of the most powerful men in the world.
item.content:encoded: The creators behind the viral TikTok account @lifeonfilm.27 give film cameras to strangers all over the world. In September, they handed one to one of the most powerful men in the world.
item.dc:creator: Mansee Khurana

item.title: A human bird flu case is thought to be found in Canada for the first time
item.description: A person has tested positive in British Columbia, Canadian health officials said, though the results must be sent to another lab for confirmation.
item.content:encoded:
A person has tested positive in British Columbia, Canadian health officials said, though the results must be sent to another lab for confirmation.

(Image credit: Cynthia Goldsmith, Jackie Katz)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Haiti replaces its prime minister, marking more turmoil in transition process
item.description: It marks even more turmoil in an already rocky democratic transition process for Haiti, which hasn't held democratic elections in years in a large part due to the soaring levels of gang violence.
item.content:encoded:
It marks even more turmoil in an already rocky democratic transition process for Haiti, which hasn't held democratic elections in years in a large part due to the soaring levels of gang violence.

(Image credit: Brian Inganga)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Arrest made in Tuskegee University shooting that left 1 dead, 16 injured
item.description: The incident follows a string of other recent deadly shootings surrounding homecoming events at schools in Southern states.
item.content:encoded:
The incident follows a string of other recent deadly shootings surrounding homecoming events at schools in Southern states.

(Image credit: 2C2K Photography)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman
